{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3529093,"name":"Jason","username":"Jason81","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-16T22:29:45.234Z","cooked":"

Our team is having very strange intermittent issue with Limelight’s 4’s megatag 2. Our issue stems from the fact megatag 2 needs to have correct offsets for the camera and good gyro data, and shows as a reflected image of megatag 1 which I attached. We’ve been working the limelights for a few weeks now and are pretty informed on how they work- in fact we’ve attempted to re-offset the LL on start up based on where we face in the robotContainer

“m_robotDrive.zeroHeading();
LimelightHelpers.SetRobotOrientation(
“limelight-gcc”, m_robotDrive.getAngle(), 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
LimelightHelpers.setCameraPose_RobotSpace(
“limelight-gcc”, -0.4318, 0.1905, 0.495, 0, 0, 180);”

We’ve also ensured that we’re supplying a correct Yaw Angle measurement in our pose estimator’s periodic (Pigeon2.getYaw().getValueAsDouble())- However we still have the issue of an inverted megatag 2. Any help would be appreciated, we’d like to get this working for aligning with a reef

Here are some relevant repositories and subsequent classes:
Correct branch - GitHub - 6500gearcats/Reefscape2025 at poseEstimatorTesting-PJ

PoseEstimator - Reefscape2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/GCPoseEstimator.java at poseEstimatorTesting-PJ · 6500gearcats/Reefscape2025 · GitHub
DriveSubsystem - Reefscape2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/DriveSubsystem.java at poseEstimatorTesting-PJ · 6500gearcats/Reefscape2025 · GitHub
RobotContainer - Reefscape2025/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java at poseEstimatorTesting-PJ · 6500gearcats/Reefscape2025 · GitHub

Issue Photo:

IMG_84621920×2560 378 KB

Jason81:

However we still have the issue of an inverted megatag 2.

Right now we are not using megatag 2 for the same issues as well. We line up for auto on one side and it appears on our screen on the other. Bad things have happened when we try to run our autos using it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T00:13:21.621Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491972,"topic_slug":"strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets","display_username":"waialua3:59","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2254,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets/491972/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529182,"name":"Jake","username":"_j_kot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_j_kot/{size}/242255_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T00:23:42.405Z","cooked":"

Your April is placed wrongly relative to the field. MT2 position is actually correct relative to the tag. Replace that tag with tag number 21 and it is going to be fine.

I am not sure how to correctly explain it, but you have to get correct yawn for MT2 to work. In your case, your 0 is wrong. Just look at the field and how your 0 is relative to that. Sorry for this shitty explanation.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T00:28:14.910Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491972,"topic_slug":"strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets","display_username":"Jake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coding Lead"},"post_url":"/t/strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets/491972/3","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529382,"name":"Jason","username":"Jason81","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T01:55:14.503Z","cooked":"

We’ve set up our real life field so that Number 18 is the tag that the robot is facing- not 21

I do agree this has something to do with MT2 needing the correct off-set and our robot the correct zero, however all of our attempts to correct this- especially in code- haven’t worked.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2025-02-17T01:55:14.503Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491972,"topic_slug":"strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets","display_username":"Jason","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70713,"username":"_j_kot","name":"Jake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_j_kot/{size}/242255_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69118,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/strange-behavior-with-limelight-megatag2-offsets/491972/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3529440,"name":"Jake","username":"_j_kot","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/_j_kot/{size}/242255_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-17T02:09:31.035Z","cooked":"

Where is driver station located? I think it is still IRL set up issue. Something where you defined the front of your robot and your zero compared to that.

Also, your yaw is set to 180 and that means that you should reset your Yaw when LL is looking away from the April tag. I don’t know if that is intentional, but that could be it. It seems like the LL is supposed to be placed at the back of the robot.

Based on your config this is how 0 yaw would look like:

Red being the LL, and it is at the back of the robot looking behind

Try there configs: “limelight-gcc”, 0.4318, 0.1905, 0.495, 0, 0, 0);
and reset north while LL points at the rief, this would bring limelight to the front and flip it.

Our limelight is on the back of our robot, the rationale being that when lining up with the reef it will have an April tag in view- but we’ve tried to turn the robot around, zero the yaw, and reset the offset so that the LL yaw/positions are correct but we have the same issue persist

I’ve had the same nagging issue with MegaTag2…

Every time I feel like I am getting good and consistent localization, I ended up getting the weird occasional “blip” where it flips ambiguity for a microsecond and puts me outside the field. It’s a shame because is otherwise incredibly accurate and stable about 99% of the time.

Mine is the opposite. Sometimes my Megatag2 will get close to (the more accurate) megatag1. But it is usually off significantly and rotates in an odd way.

FYI I’m programming in python.

Megatag2 isn’t prone to tag flipping in the same way that megatag1 is because it’s solving engine takes into account the yaw of the bot, eliminating ambiguity issues.

This sounds like you’re not setting your robot’s yaw. Make sure you use LimelightHelpers to send your yaw value to the limelight every periodic cycle. Otherwise it won’t be able to give you a realistic measurement.

Filtering comes in handy here. What my team does is checks to make sure that any measurement we get has x and y values that are within the bounding box of the field, otherwise we throw them out.
